alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Dubois; Orange; Perry (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EASTERN DUBOIS...NORTHWESTERN CRAWFORD...NORTHWESTERN PERRY AND SOUTHWESTERN ORANGE COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT/315 PM CDT/... At 344 PM EDT/244 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Jasper to 12 miles northeast of Dale to near Santa Claus. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Jasper, Ferdinand, Birdseye, Dubois, Celestine, Bretzville, Mentor, Eckerty, Ellsworth and Adyeville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT/900 PM CDT/ for south central Indiana.
